title: ENERLITES 3 Speed Ceiling Fan Control and Dimmer Light Switch, 2.5A Single Pole Light Fan Switch, 300W Incandescent Load, No Neutral Wire Required, 17001-F3-W, 120 Volts (AC), White, 2 Pack

product_information.Best Sellers Rank: Best Sellers Rank:  #11,880 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)    #33 in Dimmer Switches       #33 in Dimmer Switches

product_category: Tools & Home Improvement›Electrical›Switches & Dimmers›Wall Switches›Dimmer Switches
feature_bullets: Save space and energy with a single switch to control your 3-speed ceiling fan and dimmable lights. Compatible with dimmable LED, incandescent, and halogen lights.
Dual slide controls feature a smooth slider for full range dimming and four positions for fan control; low, medium, high, and off
Great for use in residential settings around the home such as living room, kitchen, dens or suitable commercial applications
Pre-wired with leads for easy do-it-yourself installation. Friendly U.S. based tech support available
Max ceiling fan load of 2.5A (3-speed fans only), max light load of (300W incandescent); make sure LED bulbs are the dimmable type; ETL Listed, 1-year warranty

customers_say: Customers find the switch works well with 3-speed fans and appreciate its ease of installation, with one mentioning it takes less than 10 minutes to connect. The build quality and value for money receive mixed reviews, with some finding it nicely made while others describe it as poorly made and not worth the cost. The dimming capability and flickering issues show mixed results - while some report no more flickering LEDs, others mention the lights don't dim properly. The fan speed control receives negative feedback, with customers reporting that the fans don't vary speed and the switch knob breaks off.AI Generated from the text of customer reviews

customer_reviews.review_title: 5.0 out of 5 starsEasy Upgrade for Ceiling Fans!
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2024
customer_reviews.review_snippet:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    I recently installed the 3 Speed Ceiling Fan Control and LED Dimmer Light Switch, and I’m really impressed! As a DIYer, I found the swap from my old switch to this one straightforward. The installation was simple enough for anyone, even if you're not super handy.The 3-speed settings allow for great customization of airflow, and the LED dimmer feature enhances the ambiance in the room perfectly. It’s been working flawlessly since installation, providing smooth operation for both the fan and lights.Overall, this switch is an excellent upgrade for anyone looking to enhance their ceiling fan functionality. Highly recommend it for a quick and easy home improvement!

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2025

customer_reviews.review_title: 4.0 out of 5 starsGreat idea for functionality. Durability could be better.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: They work, but durability is questionable. I've had these installed in a beach house rental property for 3.5 yrs.  Arguably they probably get rough use, but I cannot attest to this because I'm not present. What I can say is that stuff breaks more often in the rental than in my own house.  Nevertheless, the little levers on these switches can and do break off and I've had to replace.  I still like the product because they solve a number of challenges with functionality.

    Dims great, make sure your bulbs are dimmable and LED or they'll flicker, doesn't feel the most high quality but for $20, Can you really complain?

customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Fan button works hard and the High, Medium, Low positions are opposite vertically than my previous switch and oyhers in my local stores.

customer_reviews.review_title: 1.0 out of 5 starsWon't stop flickering and dimmer knob broke off.
customer_reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2025
customer_reviews.review_snippet: Would have given it 4 stars immediately after install, but less than a year later the dimmer knob has broken off and it flickers at almost any dimmer setting. It started shortly after installation, but sliding it up and down would make it stop. Now it flickers all the time. We don't have kids around that broke the little knob, it's just my wife and I.

customer_reviews.review_snippet: The switch works great had to replace my old switch of only 4 years that should last longer then 4 years. The only thing I don't like about the switch and that's me is the high speed for the fan is at the bottom of the switch rather than the top,
